bug.short_desc: 'Step over' and/or 'Step into' icons sometimes disappear

long_desc.thetext:
When I am debugging a Java application in the debug perspective, by clicking the 'step over' icon for every line, sometimes the 'step over' and/or the 'step into' icons become disabled, even though it is clear that my application is already 'waiting' at the next line. I can solve it by clicking on the right stackframe in the debug view; then all icons appear again.
I checked that this didn't happen because of a misclick into the debug view or so; I really click on the 'step over' icon and then sometimes it becomes disabled.
I am using Sun's 1.5.0_08 jdk, I have seen it happen with Bea's JRockit jvm as well. Also I have seen it happen in Eclipse 3.2.

I am experiencing this too in 3.2 and have for some time.
I found that this offen happens when eclipse re-places the stacktrace so it does not show the method I am stepping (into). Scrolling the window down does nothing, but when scrolling up to the method I am debug the icons appear again.
Its as if the step-completion events are not being seen by the debugger UI at all, at least under JRE1.5_08. (I'm using Windows/XP).

Also see bug 160855 - it appears the expressions view can interfere with stepping. However, I beleive there is another interaction that is also causing trouble. When stepping with a variable selected, the variable's details (toString()) is updated after each step. Behind the scenes, this resumes the thread to perform the 'toString()' evaluation. I think the step action is updating its enablement when the toString() is being computed which results in a 'disabled' action, since the debugger cannot step while performing an evaluation. Thus, there is a timing issue with the update of the action.

This is also a dup of bug 153913.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 153913 ***

bug.short_desc: Dates are wrong in log view

long_desc.thetext:
1) Import the CBE XML files attached 2) The dates will be incorrect in the log view.
------- Additional Comment From Ashish Patel 2006-08-28 10:24 EST -------
raising severity and priority since a IBM product needs the fix.
AC Bug 10365
Created an attachment (id=48882) Log Files

I have looked into this and it appears to be a synchronization problem. By setting a breakpoint in org.eclipse.tptp.platform.models\src-cbe\org\eclipse\hyades\loaders\cbe\XMLCommonBaseEventLoader.java in the method setCreationTime(String value), you can step through slowly enough to allow the first log file to set its creation times without being intertwined with the second, which is what is causing the error. Of course, this requires a more elegant and complete solution but I think this is where the problem stems from.
Update component and owner
There is a workaround for this which is to import the files separately. Ashish, I see your comment about why it was raised to blocker, could the workaround be used or is that not a possibility?

Created an attachment (id=49113) Proposed Patch
I have developed a patch to TPTP plugin monitoring.logui. This will keep the multiple log import function present, but logs will not be imported in parallel - rather in series. I wanted to keep it this way because our only other option would be to have the workaround (which is to tell the user to import one log at a time) and I don't think this is appropriate. It logically only makes sense to show things in the UI that actually can be used.
This fix makes a change ONLY to ImportLogWizard.java. There are NO other files modified and it will have NO impact to any other parts of TPTP - hence this is a safe patch to apply to the 4.2.1 stream without worrying about downstream effects. I have verified the patch and Liz will verify this patch too.
This fix could introduce potential performance drawbacks and it applies to all types of log files not only CBE XML.

Created an attachment (id=49184) Patch with method synchronization
I have attached a patch which Alex, Ashish and myself created this morning that synchronizes three methods from the plugin org.eclipse.tptp.platform.models (4_2_1 Branch). This patch solves the incorrect time stamp problem for all log file types. At this time we still need to complete thorough testing of the patch.

Created an attachment (id=49187) Preliminary timing results of patch
I have attached a file showing preliminary timing results for the synchronization patch with several different types of log files. The results are compared with the previous import times without the patch applied.

This fix is needed by NUMEROUS consuming products. In fact, any product in the world bundling TPTP and marketing the Import Log function (for any log type) requires this fix, otherwise, the log viewer will incorrectly interpret the timestamp.
We successfully verified the problem exists in log types other than CBEs. We specifically did testing using apache logs where we saw this problem.
I would like this defect to be put into base TPTP 4.2.1 since it is a major issue. Note that the change only involved synchronization on the method.

I have commited the fix into CVS, after analyzing the results of our tests (Ruth, Liz, mine). I have found no performance regression. Ruth I have rerun the local Cloudscape imports with 2 files and also with a single file and compared the runs with and without patch and I didn't notice any degradation in perfomance, on the contrary the results with the fix seem more consistent and on average a little smaller. I have also run remote imports with two files and with a single file and it looks good too.

Reassigning to Alex to give credit where credit is due. ;o)
Marking as Fixed as per Alex's last comment.
Closing issue

bug.short_desc: Error parser doesn't hand files with same name when it could

long_desc.thetext: There should be ways to find out exactly which file you are talking about when you have two files with the same name. In managed make the files are relative to the build directory and standard make you generally know the directory.
I have a customer complaining about this so I'll take a look for 3.1.1.

bug.short_desc: Updating CTabItem icon causes a lot of flash

long_desc.thetext:
Version: 3.3.0 Build id: I20060822-1200 Windows XP
I am experimenting with showing progress in tabs by updating the tab item's image with an animated gif. I frequently get a lot of flash as it tries to update the entire tab rather than just the image even though the new image has the same size as the old one.
STEPS 1) Load org.eclipse.ui and org.eclipse.ui.workbench from head 2) Self host with the tracing enabled for org.eclipse.ui.workbench for entries debug and trace/graphics 3) Open the problems view and rebuild - you will see a spinner
Feel free to submit a patch, find me and/or show me the problem.
I traced it for a while but there was nothing obvious. Ping me when you get a chance - it is very easy to demo.
Can we look at this? Find me.

Bug 166264 has a patch for this problem.

bug.short_desc: Run Import Team Project Set in background

long_desc.thetext: Not sure if this is possible, but it sure would be nice if the Import Team Project Set feature could run as a background task.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 64664 ***

bug.short_desc: [Project Sets] Import Team Project set UI should provide a list of existing projects

long_desc.thetext:
When importing a team project set, the current UI displays a dialog box for each existing project, offering the user a chance to replace or skip the particular project (or all existing projects).
It would be a bit more friendly if the entire list of existing projects were presented in the form of a list with check boxes allowing the user to select the ones that need to be replaced.
"The following projects already exist in the workspace. Select the projects you wish to replace with Current CVS Head" or something similar.
Sounds reasonable. However, we don't have the cycles to do it. Patches will be accepted.
*** Bug 155398 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

bug.short_desc: [Help] UAContentParser has an implicit dependency on org.eclipse.ui.intro

long_desc.thetext:
Fixed.
You may (and should) remove the workaround after upgrading to 3.3.

bug.short_desc: GenModelEditor: Adding to unmodifiable list

long_desc.thetext: The method valid() tries to add a dignostic to the Diagnostic.getChildren() list. This list is read only.
The fix is committed to CVS.

bug.short_desc: emft.eclipse.org is down / unreachable

long_desc.thetext:
Not sure if this is the right category for vserver outage issues, but hey.
http://emft.eclipse.org cannot be reached for comment at this time. Can you kick it and make it restart?
Thanks!

From dev.eclipse.org:
telnet emft.eclipse.org 22 Trying 206.191.52.45... Connected to emft.eclipse.org. Escape character is '^]'. SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_4.2
SSH seems to work... Not sure what I need to do.
Whoops. SSL problem. Never mind, I've fixed it.

bug.short_desc: Need a way to assign stdin to a file from Run Dialog

long_desc.thetext: If you go to the Common tab in the Run Dialog three is a section on Standard Input and Output. It is possible to assign stdout to a file, but there is no way to assign stdin from a file. For consistency and completeness there should be a way to define a file you want to assign to stdin, otherwise you have to manually enter a java command in the command shell to test your program.
I too would love to see this added. It's such a no-brainer, in both its utility and its ease of implementation.
In the spirit of open source, we accept contributions.

Would love to be able to direct System.err to a separate file too.
Not planned for 3.3

Could this get reopened for 3.4 / future considerations?
...Or something or another now that RESOLVED/LATER is deprecated?
This is not on the 3.4 plan. Contributions welcome.

bug.short_desc: Allow to drag task hyperlinks into the Task List

long_desc.thetext: Currently it is not possible to get task opened in Bugzilla editor or task linked in comments to some issue to the task list, except copy bug id to clipboard and use Add Existing Task action. It would be much easier to just use drag-n-drop from the issue hyperlinks.
Deferring.

I managed to minimize the scenario : 1. Open "Project Properties" (not Preferences) 2. Go to 'PHP Interpreter' node. 3. Check the 'Enable project specific settings' CheckBox. 4. Click on 'Apply' and 'OK' 5. Re-Open "Project Properties" (not Preferences) 6. UnCheck the 'Enable project specific settings' CheckBox. 7. Click on 'Apply' and 'OK'
You should get an exception message to read within the log file.
reopen

The bug source is Eclipse. (see #137398) For some reason , when unchecking the 'Enable project specific settings' CheckBox and pressing apply, it removes a node from Preferences and then the workbench looks for a node which does not exist ==> throws
Note : you can repreduce this bug also in JDT in the exact same way.

bug.short_desc: [Project Sets] Add project to existing PSF file by drag/drop

long_desc.thetext:
My update site project includes a Team Project Set (PSF) file. If a new project is to be added to the PSF, it is currently necessary to create a new PSF by selecting all necessary projects and doing an export of the Team Project Set.
It would be handy if I could drag a project onto a PSF file to add the project to the set.

May be doable. One of the potential problems is that it would be hard to detect if the project was already in the project set using the current API. However, we don;t have time to look into this for 3.3.

bug.short_desc: [Contributions] Only ViewerContribution should listen to selection changes, not its actions

long_desc.thetext:
3.2
- add a viewer contribution action to some view's menu - set a breakpoint in the contributed action's selectionChanged method - pop up the menu - choose the action, to ensure that its plugin is activated - pop up the menu again - notice the action's selectionChanged method gets hit twice
If you look at the list of selection changed listeners on the view's viewer, you'll notice that it contains not only the ViewerContribution but also the ViewerContribution's plugin actions.
The intent here is that only the ViewerContribution gets notified, and it then iterates over its actions, propagating the selection changed event itself.
There is a comment in ViewerActionBuilder$ViewerContribution's selection changed method that states: * Rather than hooking up each action as a selection listener, * the contribution itself is added, and propagates * the selection changed notification to all actions. * This simplifies cleanup, in addition to potentially reducing the number of listeners.
But it's still adding the individual actions. This could be a performance hit if the action's selectionChanged methods are expensive.
Assigning to component owner PW

bug.short_desc: [Contributions] Selection not converted for adaptable viewer contributions?

long_desc.thetext:
3.2
While looking into bug 151604 and bug 155415, it seems like there is some inconsistency in how the selection is treated for object contributions and viewer contributions. If the contribution uses adaptable="true", then the action's selectionChanged method gets the converted selection in the case of an object contribution, but the unconverted selection in the case of a viewer contribution.
Assigning to component owner PW

bug.short_desc: Read-only files are modifed because validate edit is not being called

long_desc.thetext: Create a new UML modeling project, create a model in it. Mark model file as read-only, add anything to it (a class, actor, package, etc.) - it is being dirtied. Close without saving. Put a breakpoint into o.e.g.runtime.common,core.internal.command.BaseModificationValidator.validateEdit(IFile[] file) - it never goes off. Trace it to org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.common.core.internal.command.FileModificationApprover.proceedExecuting(IUndoableOperation operation, IOperationHistory history, IAdaptable info) you will observe that since org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.emf.ui.action.AbstractModelActionDelegate is not ICommand the validate edit block is bypassed. As a consequence a read-only model is modifed.
This will be difficult to reproduce using your description, as there is no "UML modeling project" yet available from Eclipse.
I checked with Natalia and can duplicate.

one more detail - it has to be done from PE. So to summarize: 1. put the breakpoint in the FileModificationApprover.proceedExecuting 2. Set model file to read-only 3. Go to PE and try to add a class or something to the model via PE context menu

The problem is that the AbstractModelActionDelegate executes an AbstractEMFOperation on the operation history so that subclasses can both read the model and execute commands (write) in their #doRun implementation. However, this means that the file modification approval is done on the AbstractEMFOperation that does not have any affected files. The file modification approval needs to be done for each command that may be executed by subclasses.

Fixed.
Validate edit was not being performed on commands executed within the #doRun of subclasses of AbstractModelActionDelegate. This was because the AbstractModelActionDelegate was executing an AbstractEMFOperation on behalf of subclasses so that they could both read and write to the model in their #doRun method. However, the validation was being performed only on the AbstractEMFOperation, which does not declare its affected files. The validation must be done on the commands executed within the #doRun method.
To fix the problem, an ICompositeOperation is now opened on the operation history and commands executed in the #doRun method are added to the open composite. Affected files in each command are validated as they are executed through the operation history. Undo and redo of the ICompositeOperation validates the files affected by all of its children.
The same problem exists for the AbstractModelActionHandler.
Fixed. The same solution has been applied to the AbstractModelActionHandler.

bug.short_desc: [breakpoints] There is no visual cue that a class load breakpoint has been hit

long_desc.thetext:
when debugging a program that has a class load breakpoint in it, and the breakpoint is hit, there is no immediate visual cue as to what has happened.
source lookup is not activated (source file is not opened if not currently open), there is no instruction pointer, nothing. The only thing that visually indicates something has happened is the debug view shows the program suspended with the current suspended thread selected.
hitting a class load breakpoint should follow the same story as the other ones: 1. open the class file for the breakpoint (if not open), or bring to front (if open) 2. show an instruction pointer (or the like)

Created an attachment (id=48894) snapshot of workbench
This screenshot shows my workbench suspended at a class load breakpoint. The only visual cue is part of the label in the debug view...which is not immediately apparent.

Marking as won't fix. The class load is shown in the thead label. Since the class load here is for a main class (which is a contrived case), there are no stack frames yet, as the main method has not been entered.

bug.short_desc: Remove site type limitation of device-specific update site

long_desc.thetext:
Current eUpdate uses the site attribute (eg, type="org.eclipse.ercp.update.http") in the "site.xml" as the identifier of device-specific update site, and the eUpdate only accepts the update site with this site attribute. This design is to protect device users from installing the feature with content not valid for device platform. However it also decrease the flexibility of update site and update application. Also, current Eclipse update site builder doesn't handle this attribute when building the site.
Propose removing this site type limitaion, and users can use the site name or site description as the identifier.
I've checked in the modification on 2006/8/29. The change (no site type limitation) should be available in eRCP RC2 build.

bug.short_desc: [PropertiesDialog] property page not showing up

long_desc.thetext:
20060828
I changed the jdt.ui property pages to use enablement instead of object contributions. However, the following enablement doesn't seem to work: <enabledWhen> <or> <adapt type="org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject"> <test property="org.eclipse.core.resources.projectNature" value="org.eclipse.jdt.core.javanature"/> </adapt> <and> <instanceof value="org.eclipse.jdt.core.IPackageFragmentRoot"/> <not> <test property="org.eclipse.jdt.core.inSourceFolder"/> </not> </and> </or> </enabledWhen>
The page is supposed to be added to all projects with Java nature and all IPackageFragmentRoots that are not source folders.
The page never shows up under a IProject.
Debugging into it it seems that PropertyPagesRegistryReader.getObjectClassesFromEnablement(IConfigurationElement) tries to find out for waht object this is contributed. Not easy here with the or-ed condition.
Martin which page is this? I would like to make the changes myself in jdt.ui to debug.

In org.eclipse.jdt.ui/plugin.xml, find <page name="%javadocLocationPageName" In I20060829 there are two entries for this page (one for IProject and one for IPackageFragmentRoot): The workaround for this bug Replace them both with <page name="%javadocLocationPageName" class="org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.preferences.JavadocConfigurationPropertyPage" id="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.preferences.JavadocConfigurationPropertyPage"> <enabledWhen> <or> <adapt type="org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject"> <test property="org.eclipse.core.resources.projectNature" value="org.eclipse.jdt.core.javanature"/> </adapt> <and> <instanceof value="org.eclipse.jdt.core.IPackageFragmentRoot"/> <not> <test property="org.eclipse.jdt.core.inSourceFolder"/> </not> </and> </or> </enabledWhen> </page>
Fixed for build >20060930 by removing the special case anyalysis for core expressions as it was buying us very little and was overly complicated.
Verified in 20060919-0100

bug.short_desc: [api][rulers] need better names for RulerColumn and AbstractRulerColumn

long_desc.thetext:
3.3
We need better names for RulerColumn and AbstractRulerColumn, especially because 1. RulerColumn is abstract as well 2. AbstractRulerColumnRulerColumn extends RulerColumn
I suggest to rename RulerColumn to AbstractContributedRuler.
The other question is whether AbstractRulerColumn needs to be abstract at all. There is no method marked abstract. If so, we could name it DefaultRulerColumn.

+1 to changing the names.
AbstractContributedRuler is not precise IMO as traditionally the *ruler* ist the entire thing (e.g. the CompositeRuler that holds all columns) and the column is one element in the ruler.
DefaultRulerColumn makes no sense either, IMO, as while it has no abstract methods, it also does nothing without subclassing. A default implementation should at least offer some basic behavior.

>AbstractContributedRuler Typo, I meant AbstractContributedRulerColumn.
But an even better solution is to - move RulerColumn stuff into IContributedRulerColumn and remove RulerColumn - change the extension point to use an IContributedRulerColumn. - AbstractRulerColumn no longer depends on the contributed ruler column an gets pushed down to JFace Text
Fixed in HEAD. Available in builds > N20060914-0010.

long_desc.thetext:
I have been using an automated gui testing suite called dogtail and an issue with eclipse has popped up. Because dogtail querries all children when eclipse is running while dogtail is running dogtail sometimes crashes.
The output to calling sniff (an application provided by the dogtail suite)
Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/bin/sniff", line 7, in ? from dogtail import tree File "/usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/dogtail/tree.py", line 1246, in ? children = root.children File "/usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/dogtail/tree.py", line 463, in __getattr__ a = self.__accessible.getChildAtIndex (i) File "pyspi.pyx", line 481, in atspi.Accessible.getChildAtIndex File "pyspi.pyx", line 137, in atspi.exception_handler atspi.SpiException: Non-fatal SPIException: type:0 source:0 "IDL:omg.org/CORBA/COMM_FAILURE:1.0"
If dogtail crashes, please report this to the authors of dogtail.

Sorry, the point I was trying to make was that the eclipses accessibility interface is broken.
Dogtail knows nothing about CORBA.

(In reply to comment #2) > Sorry, the point I was trying to make was that the eclipses accessibility > interface is broken.
Can you please describe in more detail in which way Eclipse is broken?
Please reopen this bug when you respond.

This is shown in the screenshot in Bug 155111 , they were using 20060817 but it looked like they had 20060727. This is causing confusion.

Resolving as fixed.

bug.short_desc: if new milestone is added it will not show up in edtior until manual synch is done

long_desc.thetext: Could try to replicate with reports that do not have the 1.0 target milestone.

This should be addressed along with making configuration generic (bug#150680). Once that is done we can make requests of the abstract configuration from within the abstract editor for the available options and stop storing this data along with the repository task data objects themselves.
Pushing to 1.0 along with bug#150680.

Fixed: When updating attributes (i.e. Task Repository view action "Update Attributes") the configuration is updated as usual. Upon construction of a bugzilla editor input the task data is refreshed with the updated repository configuration (options). Previously these updated options would not be presented in the editor until the task data itself was manually synchronized forcing a save of all data including configuration data. Changes to how the offline configuration data is stored will be addressed by bug#150680.
Created an attachment (id=52080) mylar/context/zip
Nice fix, that's a much better policy.

bug.short_desc: Back Slash '\' not appearing in "WSIL no longer resolvable" error message

long_desc.thetext: 1. Open the WSE and go to WSIL page 2. Enter the URL of a WSIL in your workspace. Use back slashes where appropriate rather than forward slashes. E.g. file:/D:\wtp-builds\M-1.5.1-200608241726\eclipse\workspace\Echo\WebContent\wsdl\Test.wsil 3. Open the WSIL. Then move or delete the WSIL in your workspace. 4. Press the refresh WSIL icon in the navigator view of the WSE. 5. Notice that the URL displayed in the error message that pops up is not displaying any back slashes in the message. It looks like they are not being escaped.
Created an attachment (id=48899) Screen shot of the problem
Not critical for WTP 1.5.1.

Created an attachment (id=49566) use HTMLUtils.JSMangle()
I had a look at this. The WSDL refresh action wraps the error message in a HTMLUtils.JSMangle() call, which escapes the message. The WSIL refresh action was missing this, hence, this patch makes the WSIL refresh action use HTMLUtils as well.
Thanks Andrew, well done.

I've reviewed the fix and approve. Given the simple nature of the fix and that it makes the path in the error dialog readable, I've committed and released to HEAD and R1_5_maintenance under tag v200609070337.
Verified on wtp-sdk-M-1.5.1-200609150551.
Closed.

I spent some time debugging JavaTypeCompletionProposalComputer.computeCompletionProposals and here is what I've found
* there are three proposed types at the indicated location in the order [C, T - t, Stack<C> - java.util]
* #getJavaElement() for proposed type C returns null for some reason
* If content assist history for java.util.Stack is not empty, typeProposal.getJavaElement().getFullyQualifiedName() fails with NPE for proposal C
Another annoying thing is when code assist does work, it actually inserts "Stack<T>" even though drop-down offers "Stack<C> - java.util". Not sure if this is related.
Hope this helps.

bug.short_desc: [JUnit] TestSuite suite() does not work with Junit 4

long_desc.thetext: Moving to JDT/UI
JUnit 4 eliminated 'suite': It is not supported anymore. Have a look at JUnit 4 documentation on the net how multiple tests are executed now.
That's not correct. JUnit 4 didn't eliminate suite() it just provided a new alternative the Suite annotation. JUnit 4 is fully backwards compatible with JUnit 3.8.x.

(In reply to comment #4) > So how exactly do you use JUnit 4 so that you can run 'RunMe' as listed in > comment 0?
How I use JUnit 4? You mean like Run->Run As->JUnit Test ?
The option to run them as JUnit Test is still shown for JUnit 4 projects if a static suite() method is available.

As far I know and just verified, JUnit 4 can not run the class as specified in comment 4. For example JUnitCore.main("pack.RunMe") does not find any tests. I was wondering if you know more about the JUnit4 framework and I missed a way to do it. Yes, I also heard that Junit 4 is 'backward compatible' but it doesn't seem to be in that aspect.
David, is that a JUnit bug?
So I assume this is a JUnit 4 shortcoming. Setting to remind unless I hear something else.

Martin,
I've been unable to do much with JUnit over the summer, so I haven't had a lot of time to think about this until now. It appears that Eclipse 3.2 M2 does correctly run the code indicated in comment 4. Is this new behavior?
Thank you for noting the NPE bug--we'll fix that in the next release of JUnit.

The code from comment 4 always workes in Eclipse, but it does'n run when you leave the line 'suite.setName("MySuite")' away: Then you get the NPE. With 'shortcoming' I meant the fact that '@RunWith(AllTests.class)' is required here. You can't just run your old class with suite anymore. So JUnit 4 isn't exactly backwards compatible. So I'm not sure if this is a JUnit 4 oversight or by design.

bug.short_desc: Copy correct versions of Axis JARs to WEB-INF/lib as required

long_desc.thetext:
Here's the scenario:
- The user goes through a top-down Web service scenario with a previous version of WTP that supports an older level of Axis (prior to Axis 1.3). The WebContent/WEB-INF/lib folder would contain pre-1.3 Axis JARs. They then export the WAR. - Now using WTP 1.5, the user import that WAR and then go through a top-down Web service scenario again. The wizard would call the Axis 1.3 emitter and generate new code. The wizard would detect that that the Axis JARs of the same names are already there and would not copy it to the WebContent/WEB-INF/lib folder again.
However, this could cause compile error in the generated code since the code expect the Axis 1.3 JARs to be there but they are not.
The reason we originally have the code to check if the JARs need to be copied or not before copying is for performance. We don't want to blindly copy the JARs everytime. We need a better mechanism to determine if the Axis JARs is the right version before deciding if they should be re-copied or not.

Mark, please take a look at this problem. As discussed, we copied different versions of Axis JARs (some have different names in different versions of Axis) for WTP 0.7, 1.0 and 1.5. We also need to remove the JARs with the old name (if they exist) on top of copying the new JARs of the right versions.

Created an attachment (id=48929) Proposed patch for org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis.consumption.ui plugin
Kathy here is a proposed patch that fixes this problem.
Projects that are imported from older versions of WTP will likely have jars that are out of date in the WEB-INF/lib folder. There are more jars than just axis that could be out of date. This fix checks for out of date jars and deletes them. Once the obsolete jars are removed the new axis jars can be copied into the lib folder.
It might be worth investigating any performance issues caused by this patch because we are doing stuff with the file system. This check for obsolete jars probably only really needs to happen when projects are imported and not every time a web services is created but I'm not sure how to do that. Have a look at this patch and let me know what you think. Thanks
Seng, would you be able to have a look at this patch and see what the performance impact is?

I did a bit of investigation into the performance of the deleteObsoleteJars() method using a simple difference of systemTimes.
On a web project where all of the jars are obsolete and need to be deleted this method takes about 250 ms. This is unavoidable since these jars need to be deleted.
On a web project created in WTP 1.0 three jars need to be deleted this takes around 97 ms on my machine.
When none of the jars are obsolete and nothing needs deleting this method takes between 0 and 20 ms (almost always 0) on my machine.
So the time required to check for obsolete jars is insignificant. A small amount of time is needed to delete jars.
Since performance does not seem to be a problem this patch is ready to be reviewed.
Patch reviewed and committed. Will release later on today.
Released to HEAD and WTP 1.5.1 as v200608301709. This will be in the 08/31 WTP 1.5.1 M-build.
I was able to verify the problem described is fixed. However, I ran into a similar problem with the webserviceutils.jar. Bug 157039 is opened for it.
Verified on 09/08 WTP 1.5.1 M-driver.

bug.short_desc: web service wizard hangs during resize

long_desc.thetext:
If the user tries to resize the web service wizard to a narrower width, the wizard will try to resize it back to the optimal width, but it appears to get caught in a loop while doing so. This problem is only observed on Linux. It is related to the changes made in bug 140017.
Please assign this bug to me.
Reassigned. Also targetted to 1.5.1 with a higher severity and priority since the symptom is clearly quite nasty.

Created an attachment (id=49024) do not resize in controlListener
Here is a patch for this problem.
The looping was caused by pack() being called from within the controlResized() method in the controlListener. This patch abandons using the controlListener (too error prone) and resizes the dialog whenever we pack the composite instead.
Part of the changes in but 140017 are backed out by this fix.
Ready for review/commit. Thanks!

Thanks. Changes committed.

Created an attachment (id=48992) Fix patch
Fix the null pointer issue by creating a helper function to return _validated in AbstractEJBValidator
This patch also
a. Removes call to validator.cleanup(reporter) from ValidatorLauncher, since cleanup(reporter) is already being called from ValidationOperation(line 1399)

Approve.
Approve

Purpose: Bugzilla#155448 Popupbar should show all tools from palette not just from one group Bugzilla#155454 Creating a connection using a palette tool in a stack clears the active tool in the popup bar - Modified the default DiagramPopupBarEditPolicy installed on all diagrams so that when a palette tool from a stack is chosen, the next time the popup bar on the diagram appears, all the tools on the drawer, including those in stacks, will be displayed. This behavior is different than it was before. Previously, we would only show the tools from the stack, but a few of us agreed that this doesn't make sense so now we will show all tools in the drawer. If this is not the desired behavior, this editpolicy can be overridden. - This also solves the issue in Bugzilla#155454.
Code Reviewed by: Linda
How tested: Manual Tests: - Tested diagram popupbar editpolicy behavior on a variety of diagram types after using different palette tools.
JUnit Tests: org.eclipse.gmf.tests.runtime.diagram.ui -- all passed

bug.short_desc: [search] Search Engine wrongly set some exact method references as potential

long_desc.thetext:
I'm looking at the method ServiceLocator#registerService and I invoke the call hierarchy. I see no hits for this method, which is called in many places. Search Scope is set to "Workspace".
If I invoke search references, I see the references, but they are only "potential" matches. Why are they just potential and not exact hits? Has this behavior changed in 3.2?

Another scenario: ILog#log(IStatus)
results in 0 matches found using call hierarchy. Or 600 using search view.

This behaves correctly in my workspace (search and call hierarchy find the same 27 refences). Make sure that the search scope of the call hierarchy view (see drop down menu of this view) is set to Workspace.
Please reopen with details steps to reproduce.

I have a very standard installation of Eclipse 3.2.0 because I just lost my entire hard drive. This bug occurred on my previous setup too. So, Call Hierarchy has all default settings, which include "Workspace" scope.
I have several internal projects loaded from an internal CVS server. These projects depend only on some parts of Constellation.

I reproduced in a workspace containing some closed projects, and only the GEF Logic example imported as a SRC project. I opened ILog, and searched for the log() method. No hits were found. I was using the 3.2.0 Release build. EMF, GEF, and GMF are in my IDE, maybe a few other features. But only GEF 3.2.0 SDK + Examples should be needed to reproduce the test.
http://www.eclipes.org/gef click on downloads page to get the SDK and Examples ZIP.

Exact steps to reproduce: 1. Install Eclipse 3.2.x 2. Download GEF 3.2 and examples (http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/tools/gef/downloads/drops/R-3.2-200606270816/GEF-ALL-3.2.zip) 3. Unzip in Eclipse install (or add a links/gef.link file that points to GEF) 4. Start a new workspace 5. File>Import>Plug-in Development>Plug-ins and Fragments>Next>Projects with source folders>Next>org.eclipse.gef.examples.logic>Add>Finish 6. Open type ILog 7. In Outline, select log(IStatus) 8. <context menu> > Call hierarchy Observe: the Call hierarchy view doesn't show any children of ILog#log(IStatus)

I cannot reproduce the problem even with latest steps provided by Jerome :-( However, reading again all bug hitsory, I found an interesting point in comment 1:
> results in 0 matches found using call hierarchy. > Or 600 using search view.
I think this means that problem comes from Call Hierarchy View and not from Search Engine => move to JDT/UI for further investigations.

> I think this means that problem comes from Call Hierarchy View and not from > Search Engine => move to JDT/UI for further investigations.
I don't think that is true. All 600 matches are labeled "potential" matches, which is why they are filtered from the hierarchy search.
My best guess is that this bug is related to the "PDE classpath" problem.

It has to be said that when you're using the PDE 'add to search' feature, these archives can't correctly be resolved as they are not in the context on a classpath and are therefore only reported as potential matches.
So maybe the call hierarchy only adds non-potential matches (I didn't verify) and we should add this option.

(In reply to comment #8) > It has to be said that when you're using the PDE 'add to search' feature, these > archives can't correctly be resolved as they are not in the context on a > classpath and are therefore only reported as potential matches. > So maybe the call hierarchy only adds non-potential matches (I didn't verify) > and we should add this option.
I didn't completely understand that, but the bigger issue is that they are potential matches, not whether I can add potential matches to the call hierarchy search.
Why are they potential matches? This seems to be because of the way the PDE add all dependent JARs within projects in the workspace. This approach seems flawed. Maybe because there is no implied dependency between two JARs in the same project? For example, if I import "org.eclipse.core.resources" into my workspace, all of a sudden the behavior of the same search returns completely different results (it finds tons of exact matches). The behavior should be the same whether I have a dependency loaded in my workspace or not.

OK, I can reproduce it now. My first try was in a self-hosted workspace and it works in this configuration but not using a standard runtime session...
Back to JDT/Core as this is clearly Search Engine issue: it does return all matches as potential ones although some of them should be exact.
Probably caused by bug 73957.

bug.short_desc: Creating a connection using a palette tool in a stack clears the active tool in the popup bar

long_desc.thetext: To reproduce: - Add a line stack to the geoshapes palette with two line tools. - Create a diagram whose default popup bar does not contain the geoshape tools. - Create a geoshape using a geoshape tool from the palette. * Notice that the popup bar tool now contains geoshape tools. - Create a line using one of the line tools in the new line stack. * Notice that the popup bar tool no longer contains geoshape tools. It now uses the default tools for the diagram. It should still show the geoshape tools since this was the last palette drawer used.

Purpose: Bugzilla#155448 Popupbar should show all tools from palette not just from one group Bugzilla#155454 Creating a connection using a palette tool in a stack clears the active tool in the popup bar - Modified the default DiagramPopupBarEditPolicy installed on all diagrams so that when a palette tool from a stack is chosen, the next time the popup bar on the diagram appears, all the tools on the drawer, including those in stacks, will be displayed. This behavior is different than it was before. Previously, we would only show the tools from the stack, but a few of us agreed that this doesn't make sense so now we will show all tools in the drawer. If this is not the desired behavior, this editpolicy can be overridden. - This also solves the issue in Bugzilla#155454.
Code Reviewed by: Linda
How tested: Manual Tests: - Tested diagram popupbar editpolicy behavior on a variety of diagram types after using different palette tools.

bug.short_desc: Acquisition of write lock should ignore interrupts

long_desc.thetext:
Recently, the Lock.uiSafeAcquire() method was updated to ignore interrupts on the UI thread, because the UI thread often interrupts for spurious reasons.
This works well to prevent interruption of the acquisition of read locks on the UI thread. However, there is still an intermittent problem with write locks. The TransactionalEditingDomainImpl.acquire(InternalTransaction) method uses the non-UI-safe acquisition algorithm for the writeLock, because it is trivially available when the thread successfully gets the transactionLock. However, this will check the interrupt state. There is no need ever to check the interrupt state, here. Moreover, bombing on acquiring the writeLock leaves the transactionLock acquired and the editing domain in a corrupted state (half-acquired, but not releasable because the application thinks that the acquire was interrupted).
Updated the acquire(InternalTransaction) method to protect the acquisition of the writeLock with a loop that ignores interrupt exceptions until successful.

sgutz at ca.ibm.com

No

Minimal
8) Is this fix related to any standards that TPTP adheres to? If so, who has validated that the fix continues to adhere to the standard?
Not a standards issue

bug.short_desc: CrossReferenceAdaptor->getInverseReferences throws an exception when using feature maps

long_desc.thetext:
Created an attachment (id=48924) Patch for the Defect
This patch shows the line of code that needs to be changed.

We are invistigating this problem to see what is the best way to fix it; specially that the same code exist in the ECrossReferenceAdapter class in EMF we might need to fix the problm in both of GMF and EMF or we may just skip the FeatureMap entries

It's certainly intentional that the containment feature be used not the containing feature. Perhaps the eSetting method doesn't handle this case right. Could someone provide a simple example that reproduces the problem? Ideally just a generated model and the generated *.test project with the XyxExample.java modified to reproduce the problem.

I've opened https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=156798 and committed the patch attached to that bug (for the 2.2.1 stream) to ensure that eSetting(EStructuralFeature) works properly for open content features. There's also a test case attached to that bugzilla. That probably solves the whole problem, in which case you could make this bugzilla a duplicate of that one. For now I'm just made it depend on that one.

I'm a bit doubtful about the last comment. These cross references should only be considering references to EObjects and a reference to an EObject should always be via an EReference. Even for the case of a feature map, it's the feature of the FeatureMap.Entry that should be the feature for which eSetting is created, not the feature map feature itself, which would be an EAttribute for sure. So I think it's important to determine how an eSetting for a non-EReference ends up showing up, because that's probably the error...

Will investigate further. I looked at Ed's fix a bit closer and it is correct that we should not be getting the ClassCastException anymore since the eSetting(...) logic will delegate into a FeatureMap when detected.

(In reply to comment #9) > Will investigate further. I looked at Ed's fix a bit closer and it is correct > that we should not be getting the ClassCastException anymore since the > eSetting(...) logic will delegate into a FeatureMap when detected.
Hi we need to close on this bugzilla i've tried the patch provided by ED, modified the test he had to use CrossReferenceAdaptor instead of eCrossReferenceAdapter and called updateImportsAndExports; did not get any class cast exceptions do we need to try something else ? or can we close this bugzilla as a duplicate of the EMF bugzilla ?
We are evaluating the patch with our scenario's. Will close by end of this week, based on how this goes.
The patch supplied for this defect works fine.

Narinder,
Do you mean the patch in this defect, or the change I made in BasicEObjectImpl? I really don't think the patch in this defect is appropriate and it's quite likely to cause downstream client problems if it's applied. I.e., folks will expect that they can get that setting and use EcoreUtil.remove(Setting, value) to remove the value, but that won't work if the feature map's setting is returned. Folks should also be able to assume that the feature of the setting is an EReference....
The patch that you have sent to Dan works fine. org.eclipse.emf.ecore_2.2.1.v200608311032.jar
Cool. That's a relief. ;-) My fix is in yesterday's RC maintenance build...

closing the defect as a duplicate of 156798

bug.short_desc: Thread mix-up when debugging multi-threaded programs

long_desc.thetext:
I recently switched from Eclipse 3.1.2 / CDT 3.0.2 / GDB 6.3 to Eclipse 3.2 / CDT 3.1 / GDB 6.3 and discovered a very annoying bug in the CDT Debug view when debugging multi-threaded programs. When you select the topmost frame in another thread in the Debug view, that frame will be selected. However, when trying to singlestep the newly selected thread, the topmost frame of the previous thread is erroneously selected again. By selecting, the topmost frame of the intended thread again, you will notice that the singlestep operation really happened and you can from here on singlestep in the new thread without being switched back. However, when selecting a new thread again, the same problem happens again and you have to reselect the new thread to be able to continue.
There seems to be some inconstistency about which thread is the current between the Debug view and the CDT debug model or between different parts of the CDT debug model. This bug did not exist in Eclipse 3.1.2 / CDT 3.0.2.
I have searched the Eclipse bug database for any bugs about this and found the bug 151253 "Singlestepping a multi-thread program to fast results in unexpected behavior" which I thought could be related to this problem. Bug 151253 has been fixed in the CDT 3.1.1 branch so I downloaded the I200608210800 nightly build of CDT 3.1.1 but unfortunately the thread switching problem problem still exists.

I'm not sure whether this is relevant but bug 153500 contains a proposal to change the asynchronous tree viewer used to render various parts of the debug view (possibly including target / thread view?). It might be worth checking this out before doing a lot of work, since I believe it may fix a whole host selection / scrolling issues with these views or might obsolete any fix added in the CDT.

Created an attachment (id=57693) Proposed fix.
Modified patch from Stefan Bylund.
Marking as a candidate for 3.1.2.
Applied to the HEAD and 3.1.2 branches. Thanks Stefan.

bug.short_desc: No error message displays when choose an invalid configuration by using the 'Browse' button.

long_desc.thetext:

bug.short_desc: DataSetEditor Parameter's Link to a new Report Parameter should be selected automatically

long_desc.thetext:
In BIRT DataSetEditor's Parameters node page, when linking to a *new* report parameter, it should have been selected automatically in the "Edit Parameter" dialog.
Steps to reproduce: in BIRT DataSetEditor 1) create/update an ODA query by a custom ODA designer that defines a oda input parameter 2) switch to the Parameters node, the corresponding oda parameter is listed, with the "Linked to Report Parameter" field correctly set as "None" 3) select "Edit..." on the parameter, the Edit Parameter dialog opens 4) select the "..." icon next to the "Linked to Report Parameter" field, the "New Parameter" dialog opens 5) press Ok on "New Parameter" dialog to save the new report parameter 6) in the Edit Parameter dialog, the "Linked to Report Parameter" combo box still shows "None" as the selected value
Expects that the newly created report parameter gets selected automatically in the "Linked to Report Parameter" combo box.
Fixed in source

bug.short_desc: App hangs if extend processes to each other.

long_desc.thetext:
Build: M5-N20060825
Steps: 1) Create 2 processes, CP1, CP2. 2) On WBS tab of CP1, Drag CP2 to extend CP1. 3) Change to CP2, Drag CP1 to extend CP2.
Result: App. hang; then display: "java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException"
cyclic variability needs to be detected and prevented.
blocked to DND CP1 on CP2 in this case
DnD is blocked, but user can still extend the process by using the context menu. BTW, should the DnD blocked the 'Copy' and 'Deep Copy' also?
blocked it via context menu as well. And yes, you need to block COPY and DEEP COPY as well since that will result in circular dependency too since you have already extended one process to another
Fix is verfied on build RC1 0915.
v,closed.

bug.short_desc: Enhance the newline generation control in Xpand

long_desc.thetext:
A nice solution to handle the situations in which une must generate a single long line of code (like for instance in the Visual Studio project files .vcproj) would be the introduction of another flavor of the >>, say =>>, which would remove ALL the following whitespaces, including AND FOLLOWING any newline. And of course, one would also predefine the <<=>> construct ;-). That way one could still use indentation when creating a single line of code:
AdditionalIncludeDirectories="<<=>> <<IF pid_S.matches(".*D.*")=>> <<EXPAND includeFiles("A")=>> <<ENDIF=>> <<IF pid_S.matches(".*E.*")=>> <<EXPAND includeFiles("B")=>> <<ENDIF=>> <<FOREACH generateUserFunctionModuleSet_X() AS fmodule_S =>> "$(MSR_HOME)\Application\Conversion\<<fmodule_S>>";<<=>> <<ENDFOREACH=>> "$(MSR_HOME)\include";<<=>> "$(MSR_HOME)\GWFramework\Component";<<=>> "$(MSR_HOME)\Application";<<=>> "$(MSR_HOME)\Application\<<name>>";<<=>> "$(MSR_HOME)\Application\Conversion"<<=>> <<IF pid_S.matches(".*D.*")=>> ;"$(MSR_HOME)\Application\<<name>>\<<namespaceA_U()>>\Om"<<=>> <<ENDIF=>> <<IF pid_S.matches(".*E.*")=>> ;"$(MSR_HOME)\Application\<<name>>\<<namespaceB_U()>>\Om"<<=>> <<ENDIF=>> "
Sven, what do you think about that?
Will not be implemented
I like the idea of improving whitespace handling like that. Even if we don't want to implement it like Andrea proposed I'd like to keep this feature request open as a reminder.
ok, nevertheless, not for 4.2. Do you agree, Sven?
yes, not for 4.2

Is the path correct in the design file? How do we handle relative path for such cases?

For this case, I don't think we should show the previose template image in the new publish dailog when you are going to pubilish the report as another template. I think the template display name, description and the image should all be reselected again since they are for different templates.
So, we should not remember the relative resource and the base dir in a report from another report. If user wants to use the resource, they need to reset it again to make sure BIRT can manage those resources correctly.

bug.short_desc: [Progress] Job Progress Dialog should allow disabling of cancel button

long_desc.thetext: We have a long running User Job that at some point during its execution cannot be cancelled. We need an API to be able to programmatically disable the Cancel button in the Progress dialog or in the progress view

We also need the ability to disable user cancellation for certain Jobs, particularly in the Progress View. There are many background jobs that we run (and BTW we are using the Rich Client Platform) which are started by the system which ought not to be able to be canceled by the user. Unfortunately, even marking them system jobs doesn't put them out of reach of the user since the Progress View allows the user to show system jobs. But even some non-system jobs we would like to make uncancellable by the user.
So, specifically, we would like the ability to disable the Cancel button in the Progress View for any Job, system or non-system.

bug.short_desc: [regression]Data binding issue when insert data into list/table.

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Data binding issue when insert data into list/table.
Steps to reproduce: 1. New data source and dataset 2. Insert a list, bind it to dataset 3. Insert a data item to list detail and set a col as expression. 4. See binding pane of list item in Propery Editor.
Expected result: Only originally generated column binding.
Actual result: A new column binding from the inserted data item and each time I inserted a data item, a new binding was generated. If I deleted the data item, the binding was still there.
Reassign to UI team for further discussion.

I think if users insert a data item which uses predefined binding column, a new binding should not be created based on the data item, otherwise, user can create several bindings with the next binding based on the previous binding.
For example: col1=dataSetRow["name"] col2=row["col1"], col3=row["col2"]....
The other issue is that: When I insert a data item, a dialog pops up with the name "New Data Item". I think it's natural to think the name property is data item name, but in fact the name is column binding name. This is confusing.

+1 to reuse existing databinding column when creating new data report item.
Need to evaluate the behavior of inserting a new data item into table or list.

I dont think this is an issue.
When a user drags a data item into a table/list area, the new dialog is shown. When the user clicks on the expression builder. Two lists are shown Available Column Bindigs -> Available data sets->
If user selects one of the item from the available data set, then no new column binding expression is created, the data item points to existing column binding.
If user selects one of the item from the available column bindings, then a new binding column is created as the expression is differnt, it will be row["customer Name"].
Please let me know if you'll agree, and i will cancel this bug.

If user select an existing column binding in the expresion builder, I think we shall reuse that that column binding for the new data item.
Since it is not obvious to the user that selecting an existing column binding means creating a new derived data binding on a bound column, I think it is better performance for the data item to always reuse an existing column binding if it can.

My concern is following - If user selects an existing column binding in the expression builder. The expression shown in the expression builder is row["customer Name"], user will click ok and the dialog is closed. - Now if we implement the suggestion in comment #5. - data items resultset column will point to "cusomer Name" and the expression will show as dataSetRow["CUSTOMERNAME"] ( which is different from original expression )
Let me know if this is acceptable. Thanks.
Given this issue that the expression will change from row["X"] to datasetRow["x"], I agree that we shall keep the way it is now.
Please refer to comments above.
Close it.

Actually we want to make it easier to do this kind of incubation, the PMC suggests creating a PDE incubator much like the Equinox Incubator. In effect this becomes a "component" of PDE with bugzilla entries etc. In the CVS repo there should be a pde-incubator folder and there should be a pde incubator group. I assume the people listed below would be the committers?
Wassim et al, there is a little bit more overhead in setting this up but it will put you in a good position for future experimentation. Make sense to you?
BTW, we are looking to set up similar incubators for the other Eclipse subprojects as needed.

Webmaster, do you need any more information?

bug.short_desc: Due to inactivity, a group report gives NULL Pointer Exception on selection of TOC and Export CSV option

long_desc.thetext:
Steps to reproduce this issue:- 1. Access any Group report that lists groups in TOC 2. For some time do not do any activity on report page (say 15 mins.) 3. Now click on Toggle Table Contents Link 4. The pop window gets opened with following error message java.lang.NullPointerException org.apache.axis.AxisFault.makeFault(AxisFault.java:101) org.eclipse.birt.report.soapengine.processor.AbstractBaseComponentProcessor.process(Unknown Source) org.eclipse.birt.report.soapengine.endpoint.BirtSoapBindingImpl.getUpdatedObjects(Unknown Source) sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor80.invoke(Unknown Source)
When page remains idle for some time the same error gets displayed on selection of Export CSV option.
Note:- This issue occurs for the reports that are run using '__overwrite' option.
Any help on this is highly appreciated.
I can not reproduce this here. I leave it for more than 15 min. Please try to see if you can reproduce it.
Will this happen only after the user session has been timeout?
Hello, I was able to reproduce this issue. The browser was kept as it for about 1 hr. Then upon clicking the TOC button, got a NullPointerException. Attached below is the screenshot.
Created an attachment (id=49047) 1 hr Time out pic.

Because the generated document file is put under the folder related to the current session id, when session is timeout, birt can't locate this document file again. Anyway, throwing NPE isn't friendly.
Fix NPE when session timeout

need i18n error message.
Message File: /org.eclipse.birt.report.viewer/birt/WEB-INF/classes/org/eclipse/birt/report/resource/Messages.properties
Key: birt.viewer.actionException.DOCUMENT_FILE_NO_EXIST
Localization is a different issue from this bug. error message will be translated under normal L10n operation. So, I will close this.
Fixed it.

bug.short_desc: Lost selection of "Value of this data item" in map of data item that is nesting in table/list

long_desc.thetext:
Details: Lost selection of "Value of this data item" in map of data item that is nesting in table/list
Step: 1.New a table/list. 2.Add a data item into detail row. 3.Select the data item and add a map, and the New map rule dialog pop up. 4.Click the drop down list.
Actual result: The selection of "value of this data item" is lost.
Exception result: The selection of "value of this data item" is display.
Fixed. Add the String of "Value of this data item" into the expression Combos selection in the MapBuilder dialog.

Revert the last checkin of this bug's fixing. The cause of this bug is that when getting the iterator of the columbindings of dataitem, model returns null value even the dataitem binding to a dataset column, so leads to the String of "value of this data item" isn't added on designer codes.
Futhermore,if the dataitem doesn't binding to anything, model will not return null value when getting the iterator of the columnbindings of dataitem.
Reopen this bug and reassigns to model team to investigate.

Model's logic is correct, since if dataitem is added into table/list's detail row, its binding is held by table/list, directly obtain its binding will get nothing. Towards this case, determine dataitem's column binding according to its property "resultSetColumn" is null or not. And if dataitem has column binding, set the String "Value of this data item" into seletion.
Fixed.
Verified and closed

bug.short_desc: [find/replace] standard escape sequences in replace string

long_desc.thetext:
Use Case: I want to replace a piece of text with a multi-line string. Since Eclipse does regexp's, I thought that using "\n" in my replace string would do the trick - but that doesn't seem to work :-(
Suggested fix: Support the standard regexp escape sequences as documented in java.util.regex.Pattern.
Thanks.
